Package art

Class DTrackInertial

java.lang.Object
art.DTrackInertial
public class DTrackInertial
extends java.lang.Object
Hybrid (optical-inertial) body data (6DOF).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Modifier Constructor Description
    protected DTrackInertial​(int id)
    Constructor for not tracked hybrid body.
    protected DTrackInertial​(int id, int state, double error, double[] loc, double[][] rot)
    Constructor for tracked hybrid body.

  • Method Summary

    double getError()
    Returns drift error estimate.

    Returns ID number.
    double[] getLoc()
    Returns location.
    double[][] getRot()
    Returns orientation.

    Returns if body is currently tracked.

  • Constructor Details

    • DTrackInertial

      protected DTrackInertial​(int id)
      Constructor for not tracked hybrid body.
      Parameters:
      id - ID number (starting with 0)

    • DTrackInertial

      protected DTrackInertial​(int id, int state, double error, double[] loc, double[][] rot)
      Constructor for tracked hybrid body.
      Parameters:
      id - ID number (starting with 0)
      state - State of hybrid body (0, 1, 2 or 3)
      error - Drift error estimate (only during inertial tracking, in [deg])
      loc - Location (in [mm])
      rot - Rotation matrix (3x3-dimensional)

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Returns ID number.
      Returns:
      ID number (starting with 0)

    • isTracked

      public boolean isTracked()
      Returns if body is currently tracked.
      Returns:
      Body is tracked

    • getState

      public int getState()
      Returns state of hybrid body.
      Returns:
      State of hybrid body (0: not tracked, 1: inertial tracking, 2: optical tracking, 3: inertial and optical tracking)

    • getError

      public double getError()
      Returns drift error estimate.
      Returns:
      Drift error estimate (only during inertial tracking, in [deg])

    • getLoc

      public double[] getLoc()
      Returns location.
      Returns:
      Location (in [mm])

    • getRot

      public double[][] getRot()
      Returns orientation.
      Returns:
